description.narrative: Primary schools are safe and have capacity to provide foundational skills-literacy, numeracy, life-skills in line with national standards, using innovative approaches & fully implement efficiency (reduce repetition, increase retention and transition) support reintegration policies, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: School-aged girls and boys, especially early adolescents (aged 10-14) [in targeted districts], acquire essential learning outcomes and practice skills for life, are safe from exploitation, harmful practices and violence, and benefit from integrated social services (including in emergencies).

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF EDUCATION SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

sector.narrative: Digital learning materials and ICT in education
Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Ending violence against women and girls
Humanitarian programmes and services inclusive of children with disabilities
Provision of primary education teacher training
System strengthening - gender-responsive teaching and learning (excluding SRGBV)
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Primary schools are safe and have capacity to provide foundational skills-literacy, numeracy, life-skills in line with nationalstandards, using innovative approaches & fully implement efficiency (reduce repetition, increase retention and transition); supportreintegration policies

description.narrative: This output was discontinued following the comprehensive programme review and PBR approval in March 2021.; The output end date was set to end of December 2021 to enable completion of all open transactions. | Status:Discontinued | As-of Date:13/01/2022
